just so people are aware this is the bugged steam version of the game. it will most likely work for you but some people will be unable to create their character to start the game or adjust options as all the required fields are invisible. so give it a shot but dont be disappointed if it doesnt work.

on another note while yes this does draw story from the books that isnt present in the show on HBO this is in fact the official HBO game of thrones game as it is based on the tv show. thats why the hired people from the show to voice act the appropriate characters.

for the people saying this is terrible its baised on the books, not the TV series. Personally love the books, cant stand the tv series.. so ya imo give it a try if you like the books dont expect anything from the tv series.

Also its an atlus game... at best your looking at a 7 out of 10 rated game depending on your personal point of view.

Also to note Isn't diablo 3 online only??? pretty certain it is so that wont be pirate able im sure...

if it was based on the books alone they wouldnt have a giant HBO logo when you start the game, the characters wouldnt be designed to look like the TV actors, and they wouldnt have hired the actors to do the voices. yes it went into development before the series aired but its obvious that they worked closely with HBO on this, dont spread misinformation saying is based solely on the books. the game is by no means bad IF you like this type of game. they took alot of tried and true concepts and put their own spin on them, such as the fact that the "pause combat" doesnt actually pause it, just slows things down considerably. if your really worried about difficulty bump it up, you'll watch yourself die pretty often and find yourself saving after every small skirmish.

and as far as the diablo 3 discussion dont hold your breath waiting for this one. yes they will have it cracked eventually but your still going to need a private server for hosting.

The serial thing works, you're probably doing it wrong. 

-Run game
-Run Keygen
-Copy serial key from keygen into the activation window
-Click manual activation, and then click BACK
-Click generate Key
-Again, click manual activation, then enter the key

people having trouble activating the game do this :
- from the start menu ... search for regedit.exe.
-click edit ... find ... cyanide .
-when it finds it .. delete the whole floder .
-try the activation thing again .. don't forget to hit back .. then generate .. then manual activation again .

To People having trouble starting the game (where it lingers on the starting black "game of thrones" tiltle ) .. don't worry .. just leave it a bit and it will start automatically .. and by bit I mean like 3-4 mins ... so be patient . ... hope this helps.

Game installed fine, keygen worked fine, and got the game to work. The update is kind of important. Without the update, the game is almost unlayable compared to how well it works with the 1.1.0.0 update. 
You can get the reloaded update from TPB, or you can run the game, click play , and let the game update itself. either way works fine.

The game is not the best I have played by far, but not the worst. Combat has a real sluggish, forced feel. Voice acting could be better. At least the storyline is canon, so true fans of the series(books or show) should get enough enjoyment out of the game to be worth their time.

AVG throws a hissy fit on the keygen and wont let you access it, only way I found around it was to uninstall AVG.
Otherwise it works fine.

Game's quite fun, starts out a bit crap looking with the ten year old graphics and faces that don't move and shit like that but it grows on you.

Combat system ain't bad, I doubt it'll win any awards but it's enjoyable.
